      void ExtendedRuleProcessor.checkForPositionMoveCandidacyAndContinuity(IPlayerAgent oPlayer, IRule oRule, IPositionAgent oCandidacyPosition, java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicReference<java.lang.Boolean> bIsValidMode, java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicReference<java.lang.Boolean> bCanContinue) 
      void DefaultRuleProcessor.checkForPositionMoveCandidacyAndContinuity(IPlayerAgent oPlayer, IRule oRule, IPositionAgent oCandidacyPosition, java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicReference<java.lang.Boolean> bIsValidMode, java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicReference<java.lang.Boolean> bCanContinue)
      This method finds out whether the proivded Position can be a candidate to make a move, also it (with the help of Rule) deduces whether algorithm should proceed with the Position to find out the next possible candidate moves.
      void IRuleProcessor.tryFindPossibleCandidateMovePositions(IPieceAgent oPieceToMove, IPositionAgent oSourcePosition, IPlayerAgent oPlayer, java.util.Queue<RuleProcessorData> qData, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,IMoveCandidate> mpCandidatePositions)

      A Rule can manoeuvre in two way therefore this method makes respective calls in this method.
